Content: Elmo, Cookie Monster, Big Bird and the gang over on Sesame Street are celebrating 50 years on the air. The popular children’s program first aired in the fall of 1969 with the question, “Could television help prepare less advantaged children for school?” Since then, brightly colored puppets teamed up with humans to help educate kids in more than 150 countries and 70 languages. Over the years, celebrities including Lena Horne, will.i.am and Lucy Liu have appeared on the program. The show will celebrate the milestone with a star-studded prime-time special featuring Chrissy Teigen, Charlie Puth and Dave Grohl this Saturday on HBO.
